intro: Ugena alba, commonly known as the white ugena, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Ugena alba is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in well-drained soil.
